title: Ticket #3566: Condor should not try and change Windows firewall when not a service
description:
When HTCondor starts a user (rather than as a service), it still tries to update the Windows firewall rules. This generates a bunch of failure messages in the log.

Even worse, if more than one copy of HTCondor is running on the machine, they will each try and REMOVE each other from the firewall.

The fix for both of this problems is to have HTCondor only try and update the firewall rules automatically when it is running as a service.
